description: A brown-black leather belt with a simple iron buckle

core:description.text: A plain leather belt in brown-black, the color of old oak bark. The leather is thick and stiff, showing no decoration beyond the functional holes punched at regular intervals. The buckle is simple iron, already showing spots of rust despite attempts to keep it oiled. This is a belt for holding up trousers and carrying tools, nothing moreâ€”the kind worn by farmers, laborers, and those who cannot afford brass or silver fittings.
